articles.title: Consulting
articles.contents:
I consult with small and medium-sized businesses on the topics of
record linkage and deduplication, survey methods, data analysis,
R/Python package development, and statistical learning.
Specifically, I can help you and your team:
Validate your approaches and statistical methodology.
Improve your data science software development practices and ensure
the reproducibility of your data analyses.
Quantify uncertainty surrounding your predictions and inferences
using conformal prediction, resampling, and Bayesian methods.
Evaluate the effectiveness of your programs and activities through
data and experiments.
Integrate data from multiple sources using record linkage and entity
resolution algorithms.
Train your staff to effectively work with R, Python, git, and bash
as part of a data science workflow.
Use the form below to book a time to chat:


What to expect
My goal is to understand the problem you‚Äôre facing and the outcome
that you are looking for. If we determine that I‚Äôm a good fit, I will
then send you a work plan, a pricing estimate, and a draft consulting
agreement for your approval.
My priority is to make happen your desired outcome. I will
work with you to define a project scope which is compatible with your
budget and which brings significant value to your organization.

articles.title: üëã Welcome!
articles.contents:
Github


üëã Welcome!
This website lists some of what I do. See my research, teaching, software, and blog.
About me
I am a PhD Candidate in the Statistical Science Department at Duke
University. I have a Mathematics B.Sc. and a Statistics M.Sc. from
Universit√© du Qu√©bec √† Montr√©al. My research is currently supported by
Professor Jerry Reiter at Duke, by an Alexander-Graham-Bell Canada
Graduate Scholarship, and by a doctoral award from the Fonds de
Recherche du Qu√©bec - Nature et Technologies. I was awarded the Canada
Governor General‚Äôs Academic Medal in 2020 for outstanding academic
achievements during my M.Sc.
I have broad ranging interests in statistics. My M.Sc. research
focused on theoretical properties of Bayesian nonparametric procedures.
Recently, I have been working on more applied problems. I am
particularly interested in the statistical evaluation of machine
learning systems and in entity resolution for big data integration. My
work intersects machine learning, survey methods, statistical
evaluation, and privacy considerations.
During Spring 2022, I was working as a Data Scientist intern at the
Intact
Financial Corporation. I was part of the Rating Revolution team
which develops machine learning models to improve the pricing of
insurance products.

During Summer 2022, I was working as a Data Scientist/Researcher
Intern at the American Institutes for
Research. I worked on the entity resolution algorithms used for PatentsView.org, a patents knowledge
discovery platform led by the Office of the Chief Economist at the U.S.
Patent & Trademark Office. I developed novel evaluation methodology
for entity resolution systems (see our paper).
In my free time, I like to get involved with other students at Duke.
In 2021-2022, I was Research Coordinator for the Duke
GPSG Community Pantry, helping improve our knowledge of food
insecurity on campus. Currently, I am webmaster for the Record Linkage Interest
Group. Additionally, I worked with the Duke Applied Machine Learning
Group and with the Data+ program as a project manager, and I have been a
mentor for the Twoples directed reading program. I am very grateful for
our international academic community and I try to give back as I can. I
regularly mentor undergraduate students working on research projects
with me.
Lastly, I spend some time working on open source projects related to
my research. I maintain three R packages on CRAN and I am actively
working on an open source
Python library for scalable fuzzy string matching. My work is
supported by individual contributors through Github Sponsors
and by G-Research.
Sponsor me
Sponsor my open source work and community involvement through
Github:




Hire me
I consult with small and medium-sized businesses on the topics of
record linkage and deduplication, survey methods, data analysis,
R/Python package development, and statistical learning. Learn more on my
consulting page.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Evaluation
Multiple systems
estimation
Entity
resolution
Bayesian nonparametrics

Evaluation
Binette, O., S. A. York, E. Hickerson, Y. Baek, S. Madhavan and C.
Jones. (2022) Estimating the Performance of Entity Resolution
Algorithms: Lessons Learned Through PatentsView.org. arXiv
e-prints. arxiv:2210.01230 [link]
Multiple systems estimation
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) On the Reliability of Multiple
Systems Estimation for the Quantification of Modern Slavery. Journal
of the Royal Statistical Society, Series A [link]
[pdf]
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2020) Discussion of read paper
‚ÄúMultiple-systems analysis for the quantification of modern slavery:
classical and Bayesian approaches‚Äù by Bernard Silverman. Journal of
the Royal Statistical Society Series A 183 (3). pp.¬†35 [link]
Entity resolution
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) Modern Bayesian Entity
Resolution. Wiley StatsRef [link]
Binette, O. and Steorts, R. C. (2021) (Almost) All of Entity
Resolution. Science Advances 8 (12) [link]
Bayesian nonparametrics
Binette, O. and Pati, D. and Dunson, D. B. (2020) Bayesian Closed
Surface Fitting Through Tensor Products. Journal of Machine Learning
Research 21 (119) pp.¬†1-26 [pdf]
Binette, O. (2019). A Note on Reverse Pinsker Inequalities.
IEEE Transactions on Information Theory 65 (7). pp.4094-4096.
[pdf]
Binette, O. and Guillotte, S. (2019). Bayesian Nonparametrics for
Directional Statistics. arXiv e-prints. arxiv:1807.00305. [pdf]

articles.title: Software
articles.contents:
Python packages
PatentsView-Evaluation
pv_evaluation is a Python package for the evaluation
and benchmarking of PatentsView
disambiguation algorithms. It provides summary statistics, performance
evaluation metrics, and representative performance estimators. See the
project
website for the full documentation.

pip install git+https://github.com/PatentsView/PatentsView-Evaluation.git@release

StringCompare
StringCompare is a Python package (implemented in
C++ through pybind11) for efficient string similarity computation and
approximate string matching.

pip install git+https://github.com/OlivierBinette/stringcompare.git

üöß GroupByRule
Deduplicate data using fuzzy and deterministic matching rules. This
is under construction.

pip install git+https://github.com/OlivierBinette/groupbyrule.git

R packages
FingermatchR
Fingerprint matching tools based on NIST‚Äôs Biometric Image Software,
on FingerJet minutiae extraction tool, and on the libfmr library.


devtools::install_github("forensic-science/fingermatchR")


MSETools
Code and analyses for the paper titled ‚ÄúOn the Reliability of
Multiple Systems Estimation for the Quantification of Modern Slavery‚Äù
(Binette and Steorts, 2021).


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/MSETools")


cache

Simple interface to caching which works across interactive R
sessions, R scripts and Rmarkdown documents.


install.packages("cache")


assert

Lightweight validation tool for checking function arguments and data
analysis scripts.


install.packages("assert")


dgaFast
Multiple Systems Estimation Using Decomposable Graphical Models. This
is an efficient re-implementation and extension of the dga R package
(it is now part of dga).


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/dgaFast")


TessTools
Tools for the use of Tesseract OCR in R and for the analysis of
historical newspaper archives.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/TessTools")


splinit
Periodic spline regression and closed curve reconstruction.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/splinit")


pretty
Better baser plots in R.


devtools::install_github("OlivierBinette/pretty")


Javascript apps
Fractals
High resolution visualization for the Mandelbrot set. A Java version with
more features is also available.
Earthquakes
Visualize earthquakes on the globe.
Other software
lipsample:
Sampling from arbitrary Lipschitz continuous densities on the interval
in matlab.
